verses.roman:
sarvāśraya īśvarera praṇava uddeśa
'tat tvam asi'--vākya haya vedera ekadeśa

synonyms: sarva-āśraya—the reservoir of everything; īśvarera—of the Supreme Personality of Godhead; praṇava—oṁkāra; uddeśa—purpose; tat tvam asi—the Vedic mantra tat tvam asi ("you are the same"); vākya—statement; haya—becomes; vedera—of the Vedic literature; eka-deśa—partial understanding.
translation: "It is the purpose of the Supreme Personality of Godhead to present praṇava [oṁkāra] as the reservoir of all Vedic knowledge. The words tat tvam asi are only a partial explanation of the Vedic knowledge.

purport.content: Tat tvam asi means "you are the same spiritual identity."
